message.content:
cs.DC, cs.CR, cs.DS, cs.LG, cs.IT. 

The paper discusses committee-based blockchains, which are a type of distributed system. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing). The paper also discusses Byzantine-fault tolerant distributed consensus, which falls under the category of cs.CR (Cryptography and Security). The paper also deals with rewarding schemes, which can be considered as a form of game theory, falling under the category of cs.GT (Computer Science and Game Theory). Additionally, the paper deals with fairness, which can be considered as a form of algorithmic fairness, falling under the category of cs.LG (Machine Learning). Finally, the paper deals with communication in the system, which can be considered as a form of information theory, falling under the category of cs.IT (Information Theory).
